name: Alberry
Description: This transparent, black berry contains poisonous seeds and grows on long, straight stalks.

name: Mormusflower
Description: This flower is easily confused for an ordinary Wildleaf, however it is set apart by it's blood red center. It grows among wildleafs.

name: Wildleaf
Description: A small, white flower with a yellow centre.

name: Wolfthorn
Description: This gray thorny vine surrounds rocks and trees. Upon closer inspection, the thorns seem to be black.

name: Bitterroot
Description: This root is a golden brown and very popular in elegant cusine. Poisonous if not prepared correctly.

name: Wither'len
Description: This elven flower has become rare after Godfall. It's petals are a black and it's center is a bright blue.

name: Riverbloom
Description: This yellow and blue flower grows within rivers and streams. They emit a sweet, honey-like smell.

name: Larari'len
Description: This flower, named after the god of food and health, is a legend among druids. It is said to be one of the most potent natural cures.

name: Rose of Yrwir
Description: This golden flower grows wherever the veil between the Worldplane and the Abyss were weak. It turns to ash within weeks of first blossoming.

name: Grimmblight
Description: A light blue rose, but it's petals are made of a black, oily substance. It's thorns are sharp and black and is regared as an omen of ill fate

name: Elderthron
Description: This thick, thorny plant contains a delicious, addictive goo. It's also said to increase intelligence. Once used commonly among shamans and elders.

name: Greatberry
Description: This bush grows nearly everywhere, hence it's name. Legends tell this berry was used to poison the last king of Lynnwind.

name: Hagstalk
Description: This dark orange weed is known as an omen of a nerby hag. Hiding some under someone's pillow is said to curse them with misfortune.

name: Rotbloom
Description: This budding red flower growns on rotting corpses. Death through the flower's poison causes horrible scents to emit from the body.
